TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Row implements class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Outlook._Row

summary.span: 代表中的数据行的对象。

span.span: Represents a row of data in the object.

span.para: 这是.NET 接口派生的互操作性与相应的 COM 对象的托管代码需要 COM coclass。使用此派生的接口访问 COM 对象的所有方法、 属性和事件的成员。但是，如果方法或想要使用的事件共享相同的名称相同的 COM 对象下，强制转换为相应的主接口调用方法，并强制转换为最新的事件接口，连接到该事件。请参阅本主题的 COM 对象有关的信息。有关 COM 对象的方法和属性成员的信息，请参阅。
表组成的行和列。它表示中的数据的只读动态行集或对象。您可以将表的每一行视为文件夹，并作为项目的属性的每个列中的项目。默认情况下表包含的文件夹中的项目的属性的子集。这使得表支持快速枚举和筛选文件夹中的项目的内存中轻型行集。
如果Table对象获取从，您可以进一步指定筛选器 (在) 以获取更多受限表中的行集。
可以使用表方法： ， ， ，和获取表中的特定行。
使用获取表中的行的列值相对应的值的数组。
使用帮助程序函数， ，和的特定行的列值进行类型转换。上表中的属性值表示方式的详细信息，请参阅因素影响属性值表示方式中的表和视图类
虽然反映的基础文件夹添加和删除但表中的行，表不添加、 更改和删除的行中不支持任何事件。如果您需要表格行中的可写对象，从表中的默认 EntryID 列获取该行的条目 ID，然后使用方法对象获取整个项目，例如，支持的读写操作。上表中的默认列的详细信息，请参阅表中显示的默认属性。

This is a .NET interface derived from a COM coclass that is required by managed code for interoperability with the corresponding COM object. Use this derived interface to access all method, property, and event members of the COM object. However, if a method or event you want to use shares the same name under the same COM object, cast to the corresponding primary interface to call the method, and cast to the latest events interface to connect to the event. Refer to this topic for information about the COM object. For information about the method and property members of the COM object, see .

A Table is composed of rows and columns. It represents a read-only dynamic rowset of data in a or object. You can regard each row of a Table as an item in the folder, and each column as a property of the item. By default, the Table contains only a subset of properties for items in the folder. This makes the Table an in-memory lightweight rowset that supports fast enumeration and filtering of items in the folder.
If the Table object is obtained from , you can further specify a filter (in ) to obtain a more restricted set of rows in the Table.
You can use the Table methods: , , , and to obtain a specific row in a Table.
Use to obtain an array of values that correspond to column values at that row in the Table.

Use the helper functions , , and to facilitate type conversion of column values at a specific row. For more information on property value representation in a Table, see Factors Affecting Property Value Representation in the Table and View Classes

Although additions and deletions of the underlying folder are reflected by the rows in the Table, the Table does not support any events for adding, changing, and removing of rows. If you require a writeable object from the Table row, obtain the Entry ID for that row from the default EntryID column in the Table and then use the method of the object to obtain a full item, such as a or a , that supports read-write operations. For more information on default columns in a Table, see Default Properties Displayed in a Table.
